reused_details.reused: (AP Photo/Luca Bruno) DOHA, Qatar (AP) ' Luis Enrique was replaced by Luis de la Fuente as Spain's coach on Thursday, two days after the national team was eliminated in the round of 16 at the World Cup.
reused_by_aic: Photograph: Koji Watanabe/Getty Images PA Media and Reuters Thu 8 Dec 2022 12.51 GMT Luis Enrique has left his post as Spain manager after the side's World Cup last-16 exit to Morocco, with the national team's under-21 coach, Luis de la Fuente, to replace him.
Luis Enrique, who guided Barcelona to Champions League glory in 2015, took charge of his country in 2018, shortly after Spain's exit from that year's World Cup.

reused_details.reused: Other candidates who had been considered besides De la Fuente, who was Spain's under-21 coach, included former Belgium manager Roberto Mart'nez and former Athletic Bilbao coach Marcelino Garc'a Toral.
reused_by_aic: A subsequent statement added: 'The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new national coach.

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique took over the national team in 2018 to start revamping the squad after its elimination in the round of 16 of the World Cup in Russia.
reused_by_aic: Luis Enrique, who guided Barcelona to Champions League glory in 2015, took charge of his country in 2018, shortly after Spain's exit from that year's World Cup.

reused_details.reused: He helped Spain reach the last four of the Nations League twice, including this season and last year, when it lost the final to France.
reused_by_aic: Spain also reached a Nations League final under his guidance but the coach's future had been the subject of speculation for some time, with reports he was considering a return to club football after the World Cup.

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique's contract ended after the World Cup.
reused_by_aic: Luis Enrique's contract with Spain, which expires at the end of this year, will not be renewed.

reused_details.reused: "The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new (Spain) coach," RFEF said in a statement.
reused_by_aic: A subsequent statement added: 'The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new national coach.

reused_details.reused: "The ... RFEF has delivered to the president a report in which it determined that a new project should start for the Spain national team, with the aim of continuing the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work carried out by Luis Enrique (and the staff).
reused_by_aic: 'The sporting management of the RFEF has handed to the president a report in which it is determined a new project should start for the Spain national team, with the aim of continuing with the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work of Luis Enrique and his coaches.

reused_details.reused: "Both the RFEF president Luis Rubiales and sports director, Jose Francisco Molina have informed Luis Enrique of the decision.
reused_by_aic: 'Both the president, Luis Rubiales, and the sports director, Jose Francisco Molina, have transmitted the decision to [Luis Enrique].

reused_details.reused: The RFEF would like to thank Luis Enrique and his entire coaching staff for the work done in the last few years."
reused_by_aic: The RFEF energetically wishes Luis Enrique and his team the best of luck in their future professional projects.' De La Fuente's appointment is set to be confirmed next Monday, 12 December, in a meeting of the RFEF's board of directors.

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique, who was first appointed Spain coach in 2018, had a contract until the end of the year.
reused_by_aic: Luis Enrique, who guided Barcelona to Champions League glory in 2015, took charge of his country in 2018, shortly after Spain's exit from that year's World Cup.

reused_details.reused: De la Fuente, 61, joined the RFEF in 2013 as the under-15 manager having worked with players like Marco Asensio, goalkeeper Unai Simon, Eric Garcia, Pau Torres, Pedri, Carlos Soler and Dani Olmo when they were youngsters.
reused_by_aic: A subsequent statement added: 'The RFEF has chosen Luis de la Fuente as the new national coach.

reused_details.reused: The 52-year-old Enrique had been in charge since 2018 and led the Spaniards to the semifinals of UEFA Euro 2020, but the Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) have announced that Enrique is gone.

reused_details.reused: Luis Enrique has left his role as coach of Spain's national team after the country crashed out of the World Cup by losing on penalties to Morocco.
reused_by_aic: Photograph: Koji Watanabe/Getty Images PA Media and Reuters Thu 8 Dec 2022 12.51 GMT Luis Enrique has left his post as Spain manager after the side's World Cup last-16 exit to Morocco, with the national team's under-21 coach, Luis de la Fuente, to replace him.

reused_details.reused: The Spanish Football Federation (RFEF) said in a statement that it "would like to thank Luis Enrique and all his coaching staff for their work at the head of the senior national team over the last few years".
reused_by_aic: The Spanish FA (RFEF) issued a statement on Thursday thanking Luis Enrique for his service and expressing its desire to start 'a new project' for the national team.

The RFEF energetically wishes Luis Enrique and his team the best of luck in their future professional projects.' De La Fuente's appointment is set to be confirmed next Monday, 12 December, in a meeting of the RFEF's board of directors.

reused_details.reused: "The RFEF sports management has sent the president a report in which it is determined that a new project for the Spanish national football team should be started, with the aim of continuing the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work carried out by Luis Enrique and his collaborators," it added.
reused_by_aic: 'The sporting management of the RFEF has handed to the president a report in which it is determined a new project should start for the Spain national team, with the aim of continuing with the growth achieved in recent years thanks to the work of Luis Enrique and his coaches.

reused_details.reused: The federation pointed out that under Enrique, Spain had reached the final four of the UEFA Nations League twice out of three attempts ' last year they lost in the final to France ' and the semi-finals of Euro 2020, when they lost to the eventual winners Italy on penalties.
reused_by_aic: Spain also reached a Nations League final under his guidance but the coach's future had been the subject of speculation for some time, with reports he was considering a return to club football after the World Cup.
